1â†’/**
     2â†’ * ModeCard Utility Functions
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * Helper functions for formatting and displaying mode data in the ModeCard component.
     5â†’ *
     6â†’ * @module components/cloud-storage/mode-card-utils
     7â†’ */
     8â†’
     9â†’/**
    10â†’ * Format category for display
    11â†’ *
    12â†’ * @param category - Raw category string (e.g., "daw-control")
    13â†’ * @returns Formatted category string (e.g., "DAW Control")
    14â†’ */
    15â†’export function formatCategory(category: string | undefined): string {
    16â†’  if (!category) return 'Uncategorized';
    17â†’
    18â†’  return category
    19â†’    .split('-')
    20â†’    .map((word) => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))
    21â†’    .join(' ');
    22â†’}
    23â†’
    24â†’/**
    25â†’ * Get initials from name or email
    26â†’ *
    27â†’ * @param name - User's display name
    28â†’ * @param email - User's email address
    29â†’ * @returns Two-character initials
    30â†’ */
    31â†’export function getInitials(screenName: string | undefined): string {
    32â†’  if (!screenName) {
    33â†’    return '??';
    34â†’  }
    35â†’
    36â†’  const parts = screenName.split(/[\s_-]+/);
    37â†’  if (parts.length >= 2) {
    38â†’    return `${parts[0][0]}${parts[1][0]}`.toUpperCase();
    39â†’  }
    40â†’  return screenName.slice(0, 2).toUpperCase();
    41â†’}
    42â†’
    43â†’/**
    44â†’ * Format star rating for display
    45â†’ *
    46â†’ * @param rating - Numeric rating value
    47â†’ * @returns Formatted rating string with one decimal place
    48â†’ */
    49â†’export function formatRating(rating: number): string {
    50â†’  return rating.toFixed(1);
    51â†’}
    52â†’
    53â†’/**
    54â†’ * Format large numbers with K/M suffix
    55â†’ *
    56â†’ * @param value - Numeric value to format
    57â†’ * @returns Formatted string with K or M suffix for large numbers
    58â†’ *
    59â†’ * @example
    60â†’ * formatMetric(1234) // "1.2K"
    61â†’ * formatMetric(1234567) // "1.2M"
    62â†’ * formatMetric(42) // "42"
    63â†’ */
    64â†’export function formatMetric(value: number): string {
    65â†’  if (value >= 1000000) {
    66â†’    return `${(value / 1000000).toFixed(1)}M`;
    67â†’  }
    68â†’  if (value >= 1000) {
    69â†’    return `${(value / 1000).toFixed(1)}K`;
    70â†’  }
    71â†’  return value.toString();
    72â†’}
    73â†’
    74â†’/**
    75â†’ * Truncate description text
    76â†’ *
    77â†’ * @param text - Description text to truncate
    78â†’ * @param maxLength - Maximum length before truncation
    79â†’ * @returns Truncated text with ellipsis if needed
    80â†’ */
    81â†’export function truncateDescription(text: string, maxLength: number = 120): string {
    82â†’  if (text.length <= maxLength) return text;
    83â†’  return text.slice(0, maxLength).trim() + '...';
    84â†’}

### Design Principles

1. **Interface-First**: All services implement clear interfaces
2. **Dependency Injection**: Services injected via constructors
3. **No Fallbacks**: Throw descriptive errors instead of using mock data
4. **Type Safety**: Comprehensive TypeScript types throughout
5. **Optimistic Updates**: UI updates immediately, rollback on error
6. **Single Responsibility**: Each component has one clear purpose

---

## Database Changes

### New Database Functions

#### `generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER)`

Generate multiple unique screen name options in a single call.

\```sql
-- Migration: 20251009_generate_screen_name_batch.sql

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER DEFAULT 10)
RETURNS TABLE(screen_name TEXT) AS $$
DECLARE
  max_attempts INT := count * 5; -- Allow up to 5x attempts
  attempts INT := 0;
  generated_name TEXT;
  names TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
  -- Generate unique screen names
  WHILE array_length(names, 1) < count AND attempts < max_attempts LOOP
    attempts := attempts + 1;
    generated_name := generate_friendly_screenname();

    -- Check if name is unique (not in existing profiles and not in our batch)
    IF NOT EXISTS (
      SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE user_profiles.screen_name = generated_name
    ) AND NOT (generated_name = ANY(names)) THEN
      names := array_append(names, generated_name);
    END IF;
  END LOOP;

  -- Return the generated names
  RETURN QUERY SELECT unnest(names);
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

COMMENT ON FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(INTEGER) IS
  'Generates a batch of unique friendly screen names for user selection';
\```

#### `validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)`

Validate that a screen name is available for use.

\```sql
-- Migration: 20251009_validate_screen_name_available.sql

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)
RETURNS BOOLEAN AS $$
BEGIN
  RETURN NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE screen_name = name
  );
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

COMMENT ON FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(TEXT) IS
  'Checks if a screen name is available (not already taken)';
\```

### RLS Policy Updates

Add RLS policy to allow users to update their own profile:

\```sql
-- Migration: 20251009_profile_update_policy.sql

-- Allow users to update their own profile
CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
  ON user_profiles
  FOR UPDATE
  USING (auth.uid() = id)
  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);

-- Allow users to read their own profile
CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
  ON user_profiles
  FOR SELECT
  USING (auth.uid() = id);
\```

## Service Layer

### UserProfileService Interface

\```typescript
// src/services/user-profile-service.ts

/**
 * User profile data
 */
export interface UserProfile {
  id: string;
  screenName: string;
  avatarUrl?: string;
  createdAt: string;
  modifiedAt: string;
}

/**
 * Database row type (snake_case)
 */
interface UserProfileRow {
  id: string;
  screen_name: string;
  avatar_url: string | null;
  created_at: string;
  modified_at: string;
}

/**
 * Interface for user profile operations
 */
export interface IUserProfileService {
  /**
   * Get the current user's profile
   */
  getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile>;

  /**
   * Generate multiple screen name options
   *
   * @param count Number of options to generate (default: 10)
   * @returns Array of available screen names
   */
  generateScreenNameOptions(count?: number): Promise<string[]>;

  /**
   * Update the user's screen name
   *
   * @param newScreenName The new screen name to set
   * @throws Error if screen name is already taken
   */
  updateScreenName(newScreenName: string): Promise<UserProfile>;

  /**
   * Validate that a screen name is available
   *
   * @param screenName Screen name to validate
   * @returns true if available, false if taken
   */
  validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName: string): Promise<boolean>;
}
\```

### UserProfileService Implementation

\```typescript
// src/services/user-profile-service.ts

import { SupabaseClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';

/**
 * UserProfileService implementation using Supabase
 */
export class UserProfileService implements IUserProfileService {
  private readonly supabase: SupabaseClient;

  constructor(supabase: SupabaseClient) {
    this.supabase = supabase;
  }

  /**
   * Get current user ID from session
   */
  private async getCurrentUserId(): Promise<string> {
    const { data: { user }, error } = await this.supabase.auth.getUser();

    if (error || !user) {
      throw new Error('User not authenticated. Please sign in to access profile.');
    }

    return user.id;
  }

  /**
   * Convert database row to UserProfile
   */
  private toUserProfile(row: UserProfileRow): UserProfile {
    return {
      id: row.id,
      screenName: row.screen_name,
      avatarUrl: row.avatar_url || undefined,
      createdAt: row.created_at,
      modifiedAt: row.modified_at,
    };
  }

  async getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile> {
    const userId = await this.getCurrentUserId();

    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
      .from('user_profiles')
      .select('*')
      .eq('id', userId)
      .single();

    if (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to fetch user profile: ${error.message}`);
    }

    if (!data) {
      throw new Error('User profile not found. Profile should exist for authenticated users.');
    }

    return this.toUserProfile(data as UserProfileRow);
  }

  async generateScreenNameOptions(count: number = 10): Promise<string[]> {
    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
      .rpc('generate_screen_name_batch', { count });

    if (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to generate screen name options: ${error.message}`);
    }

    if (!data || data.length === 0) {
      throw new Error('Failed to generate screen name options. Please try again.');
    }

    return data.map((row: { screen_name: string }) => row.screen_name);
  }

  async updateScreenName(newScreenName: string): Promise<UserProfile> {
    const userId = await this.getCurrentUserId();

    // Validate screen name is available
    const isAvailable = await this.validateScreenNameAvailable(newScreenName);
    if (!isAvailable) {
      throw new Error(`Screen name "${newScreenName}" is already taken. Please choose another.`);
    }

    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
      .from('user_profiles')
      .update({ screen_name: newScreenName })
      .eq('id', userId)
      .select()
      .single();

    if (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to update screen name: ${error.message}`);
    }

    if (!data) {
      throw new Error('Failed to update screen name. No data returned from database.');
    }

    return this.toUserProfile(data as UserProfileRow);
  }

  async validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName: string): Promise<boolean> {
    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
      .rpc('validate_screen_name_available', { name: screenName });

    if (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to validate screen name: ${error.message}`);
    }

    return data === true;
  }
}

/**
 * Factory function to create UserProfileService
 */
export function createUserProfileService(supabase: SupabaseClient): IUserProfileService {
  return new UserProfileService(supabase);
}
\```

## API Design

### React Query Hooks

\```typescript
// src/hooks/use-user-profile.ts

import { useQuery, useMutation, useQueryClient } from '@tanstack/react-query';
import { useSupabase } from '@/hooks/use-supabase';
import { createUserProfileService, UserProfile } from '@/services/user-profile-service';
import { toast } from '@/components/ui/sonner';

/**
 * Query keys for user profile queries
 */
export const userProfileKeys = {
  all: ['userProfile'] as const,
  profile: () => [...userProfileKeys.all, 'current'] as const,
  screenNameOptions: () => [...userProfileKeys.all, 'screenNameOptions'] as const,
};

/**
 * Hook to fetch current user profile
 */
export function useUserProfile() {
  const supabase = useSupabase();
  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);

  return useQuery({
    queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile(),
    queryFn: () => service.getUserProfile(),
    staleTime: 5 * 60 * 1000, // 5 minutes
  });
}

/**
 * Hook to generate screen name options
 */
export function useGenerateScreenNames(count: number = 10) {
  const supabase = useSupabase();
  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);

  return useQuery({
    queryKey: [...userProfileKeys.screenNameOptions(), count],
    queryFn: () => service.generateScreenNameOptions(count),
    staleTime: 0, // Always fetch fresh names
    gcTime: 0, // Don't cache
  });
}

/**
 * Hook to update screen name with optimistic updates
 */
export function useUpdateScreenName() {
  const supabase = useSupabase();
  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
  const queryClient = useQueryClient();

  return useMutation({
    mutationFn: (newScreenName: string) => service.updateScreenName(newScreenName),

    // Optimistic update
    onMutate: async (newScreenName: string) => {
      // Cancel outgoing refetches
      await queryClient.cancelQueries({ queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile() });

      // Snapshot previous value
      const previousProfile = queryClient.getQueryData<UserProfile>(
        userProfileKeys.profile()
      );

      // Optimistically update
      if (previousProfile) {
        queryClient.setQueryData<UserProfile>(
          userProfileKeys.profile(),
          {
            ...previousProfile,
            screenName: newScreenName,
          }
        );
      }

      return { previousProfile };
    },

    // Rollback on error
    onError: (error, newScreenName, context) => {
      if (context?.previousProfile) {
        queryClient.setQueryData(
          userProfileKeys.profile(),
          context.previousProfile
        );
      }

      toast.error('Failed to Update Screen Name', {
        description: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error occurred',
      });
    },

    // Success
    onSuccess: (updatedProfile) => {
      queryClient.setQueryData(
        userProfileKeys.profile(),
        updatedProfile
      );

      toast.success('Screen Name Updated', {
        description: `Your screen name is now "${updatedProfile.screenName}"`,
      });
    },

    // Always refetch after error or success
    onSettled: () => {
      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile() });
    },
  });
}

/**
 * Hook to validate screen name availability
 */
export function useValidateScreenName() {
  const supabase = useSupabase();
  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);

  return useMutation({
    mutationFn: (screenName: string) => service.validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName),
  });
}
\```

export function Profile(): React.ReactElement {
  const { data: profile, isLoading, error } = useUserProfile();

  if (isLoading) {
    return <ProfileSkeleton />;
  }

  if (error) {
    return <ProfileError error={error} />;

  );
}

\```typescript
export function ScreenNamePicker({
  currentScreenName,
  onSelect,
  selectedScreenName,
}: ScreenNamePickerProps): React.ReactElement {
  const [optionCount] = React.useState(10);
  const { data: options, isLoading, refetch, isFetching } = useGenerateScreenNames(optionCount);

  const handleRegenerate = () => {
    refetch();
  };

  return (
    <Card>
      <CardHeader>
        <CardTitle>Choose a Screen Name</CardTitle>
        <CardDescription>
          Select a friendly screen name from the options below
        </CardDescription>
      </CardHeader>
      <CardContent>
        {isLoading ? (
          <ScreenNameOptionsSkeleton count={optionCount} />
        ) : options ? (
          <RadioGroup value={selectedScreenName} onValueChange={onSelect}>
            {options.map((name) => (
              <div key={name} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
                <RadioGroupItem value={name} id={name} />
                <Label htmlFor={name} className="flex-1 cursor-pointer">
                  {name}
                  {name === currentScreenName && (
                    <Badge variant="secondary" className="ml-2">
                      Current
                    </Badge>
                  )}
                </Label>
              </div>
            ))}
          </RadioGroup>
        ) : (
          <div className="text-center text-muted-foreground">
            Failed to generate options
          </div>
        )}
      </CardContent>
      <CardFooter>
        <Button
          variant="outline"
          onClick={handleRegenerate}
          disabled={isFetching}
        >
          {isFetching ? (
            <>
              <Loader2 className="mr-2 h-4 w-4 animate-spin" />
              Generating...
            </>
          ) : (
            <>
              <RefreshCw className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" />
              Regenerate Options
            </>
          )}
        </Button>
      </CardFooter>
    </Card>
  );
}
\```

## User Flow & UX

### Happy Path Flow

\```
1. User clicks "Profile" in navigation
   â†“
2. Profile page loads with current screen name
   â†“
3. User sees "Choose a Screen Name" section
   â†“
4. 10 screen name options are auto-generated and displayed
   â†“
5. User clicks radio button to select a new name
   â†“
6. "Save" button becomes enabled
   â†“
7. User clicks "Save"
   â†“
8. Optimistic update: UI shows new name immediately
   â†“
9. API request completes successfully
   â†“
10. Success toast: "Screen name updated!"
   â†“
11. Profile displays new screen name
\```

### Alternative Flows

#### Regenerate Options
\```
1. User views initial 10 options
   â†“
2. User doesn't like any options
   â†“
3. User clicks "Regenerate Options"
   â†“
4. Button shows loading state
   â†“
5. New batch of 10 options appears
   â†“
6. Previous selection is cleared
\```

#### Screen Name Taken (Edge Case)
\```
1. User selects name "happy-panda-42"
   â†“
2. Another user takes that name before save
   â†“
3. User clicks "Save"
   â†“
4. API returns error: "Screen name already taken"
   â†“
5. Optimistic update rolls back
   â†“
6. Error toast displays
   â†“
7. User can select different name or regenerate
\```

#### Cancel Changes
\```
1. User selects new name
   â†“
2. User clicks "Cancel"
   â†“
3. Selection is cleared
   â†“
4. No API call made
\```

### UX Considerations

1. **Immediate Feedback**: Optimistic updates make the UI feel instant
2. **Clear Selection State**: Radio buttons with labels, current name badged
3. **Loading States**: Skeletons and spinners during async operations
4. **Error Recovery**: Clear error messages with actionable next steps
5. **Accessibility**: Keyboard navigation, screen reader support, ARIA labels
6. **Mobile Responsive**: Stack layout on small screens
7. **Visual Hierarchy**: Clear sections with cards and separators

## Security Considerations

### Row Level Security (RLS)

All database operations must respect RLS policies:

\```sql
-- Users can only read their own profile
CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
  ON user_profiles
  FOR SELECT
  USING (auth.uid() = id);

-- Users can only update their own profile
CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
  ON user_profiles
  FOR UPDATE
  USING (auth.uid() = id)
  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
\```

### Validation Requirements

1. **Server-Side Validation**:
   - Screen name uniqueness check before update
   - Screen name format validation (matches pattern)
   - Rate limiting on screen name changes (optional future)

2. **Client-Side Validation**:
   - Non-empty selection
   - Selection from generated options only
   - Disable save if no changes

3. **Authentication**:
   - All API calls require authenticated user
   - Service layer validates auth.uid() matches profile.id

### Attack Vectors to Prevent

1. **Race Conditions**: Two users selecting same name
   - Mitigation: Database uniqueness constraint + validation before update

2. **Enumeration**: Guessing valid screen names
   - Mitigation: Only allow selection from generated options

3. **Spam**: Rapid screen name changes
   - Mitigation: (Future) Rate limit updates per user per day

4. **SQL Injection**: Malicious input in screen name
   - Mitigation: Parameterized queries (Supabase handles this)

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests

#### Service Layer Tests

\```typescript
// src/services/user-profile-service.test.ts

describe('UserProfileService', () => {
  let service: UserProfileService;
  let mockSupabase: jest.Mocked<SupabaseClient>;

  beforeEach(() => {
    mockSupabase = createMockSupabaseClient();
    service = new UserProfileService(mockSupabase);
  });

  describe('getUserProfile', () => {
    it('should fetch user profile successfully', async () => {
      const mockProfile = {
        id: 'user-123',
        screen_name: 'happy-panda-42',
        avatar_url: null,
        created_at: '2025-01-01T00:00:00Z',
        modified_at: '2025-01-01T00:00:00Z',
      };

      mockSupabase.from.mockReturnValue({
        select: jest.fn().mockReturnValue({
          eq: jest.fn().mockReturnValue({
            single: jest.fn().mockResolvedValue({ data: mockProfile, error: null }),
          }),
        }),
      });

      const result = await service.getUserProfile();

      expect(result).toEqual({
        id: 'user-123',
        screenName: 'happy-panda-42',
        avatarUrl: undefined,
        createdAt: '2025-01-01T00:00:00Z',
        modifiedAt: '2025-01-01T00:00:00Z',
      });
    });

    it('should throw error when user not authenticated', async () => {
      mockSupabase.auth.getUser.mockResolvedValue({
        data: { user: null },
        error: new Error('Not authenticated'),
      });

      await expect(service.getUserProfile()).rejects.toThrow(
        'User not authenticated'
      );
    });
  });

  describe('generateScreenNameOptions', () => {
    it('should generate 10 screen names by default', async () => {
      const mockNames = Array.from({ length: 10 }, (_, i) => ({
        screen_name: `test-name-${i}`,
      }));

      mockSupabase.rpc.mockResolvedValue({ data: mockNames, error: null });

      const result = await service.generateScreenNameOptions();

      expect(result).toHaveLength(10);
      expect(mockSupabase.rpc).toHaveBeenCalledWith('generate_screen_name_batch', {
        count: 10,
      });
    });

    it('should throw error when generation fails', async () => {
      mockSupabase.rpc.mockResolvedValue({
        data: null,
        error: new Error('Generation failed'),
      });

      await expect(service.generateScreenNameOptions()).rejects.toThrow(
        'Failed to generate screen name options'
      );
    });
  });

  describe('updateScreenName', () => {
    it('should update screen name when available', async () => {
      // Mock availability check
      mockSupabase.rpc.mockResolvedValueOnce({ data: true, error: null });

      // Mock update
      const updatedProfile = {
        id: 'user-123',
        screen_name: 'cool-cat-99',
        avatar_url: null,
        created_at: '2025-01-01T00:00:00Z',
        modified_at: '2025-01-02T00:00:00Z',
      };

      mockSupabase.from.mockReturnValue({
        update: jest.fn().mockReturnValue({
          eq: jest.fn().mockReturnValue({
            select: jest.fn().mockReturnValue({
              single: jest.fn().mockResolvedValue({ data: updatedProfile, error: null }),
            }),
          }),
        }),
      });

      const result = await service.updateScreenName('cool-cat-99');

      expect(result.screenName).toBe('cool-cat-99');
    });

    it('should throw error when name is taken', async () => {
      // Mock availability check returning false
      mockSupabase.rpc.mockResolvedValue({ data: false, error: null });

      await expect(service.updateScreenName('taken-name-123')).rejects.toThrow(
        'Screen name "taken-name-123" is already taken'
      );
    });
  });
});
\```

const createWrapper = () => {
  const queryClient = new QueryClient({
    defaultOptions: { queries: { retry: false } },
  });
  return ({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) => (
    <QueryClientProvider client={queryClient}>{children}</QueryClientProvider>
  );
};

describe('useUserProfile', () => {
  it('should fetch user profile', async () => {
    const { result } = renderHook(() => useUserProfile(), {
      wrapper: createWrapper(),
    });

    await waitFor(() => expect(result.current.isSuccess).toBe(true));

    expect(result.current.data).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.current.data?.screenName).toBeTruthy();
  });
});

describe('useUpdateScreenName', () => {
  it('should update screen name optimistically', async () => {
    const { result: profileResult } = renderHook(() => useUserProfile(), {
      wrapper: createWrapper(),
    });

    await waitFor(() => expect(profileResult.current.isSuccess).toBe(true));

    const originalName = profileResult.current.data?.screenName;

    const { result: mutationResult } = renderHook(() => useUpdateScreenName(), {
      wrapper: createWrapper(),
    });

    mutationResult.current.mutate('new-name-123');

    await waitFor(() => expect(mutationResult.current.isSuccess).toBe(true));

    expect(profileResult.current.data?.screenName).toBe('new-name-123');
    expect(originalName).not.toBe('new-name-123');
  });
});
\```

    expect(screenName).toBeTruthy();
  });

  test('should change screen name successfully', async ({ page }) => {
    await page.goto('/profile');

    // Wait for options to load
    await page.waitForSelector('[role="radio"]');

    // Select first option
    const firstOption = page.locator('[role="radio"]').first();
    await firstOption.click();

    // Click save
    await page.click('button:has-text("Save")');

    // Should see success toast
    await expect(page.locator('.sonner-toast')).toContainText('Screen Name Updated');

    // Screen name should update in UI
    const newName = await firstOption.getAttribute('value');
    const displayedName = await page.textContent('[data-testid="current-screen-name"]');
    expect(displayedName).toBe(newName);
  });

  test('should regenerate screen name options', async ({ page }) => {
    await page.goto('/profile');

    // Get first option text
    const firstOption = page.locator('[role="radio"]').first();
    const originalText = await firstOption.getAttribute('value');

    // Click regenerate
    await page.click('button:has-text("Regenerate")');

    // Wait for new options
    await page.waitForTimeout(500);

    // First option should be different
    const newText = await firstOption.getAttribute('value');
    expect(newText).not.toBe(originalText);
  });
});

## Risk Mitigation

### Identified Risks

| Risk | Impact | Probability | Mitigation |
|------|--------|-------------|------------|
| Race condition: two users select same name | High | Low | Database uniqueness constraint + validation before update |
| Screen name generation fails to produce unique names | Medium | Low | Batch generation with retry logic, fallback to UUID suffix |
| Optimistic update causes UI inconsistency | Medium | Low | Rollback on error, refetch after success |
| Performance degradation with large user base | Medium | Medium | Index on screen_name column, cache query results |
| User changes screen name too frequently | Low | Medium | (Future) Rate limit updates per user per day |
| Accessibility issues block users | High | Low | Comprehensive accessibility testing before launch |

### Rollback Plan

If critical issues occur in production:

1. **Immediate Rollback**:
   - Revert application deployment to previous version
   - Keep database migrations in place (they don't break existing functionality)
   - Monitor error rates return to baseline

2. **Partial Rollback**:
   - Hide "Profile" link from navigation via feature flag
   - Keep backend functionality intact
   - Investigate and fix issues in staging

3. **Data Integrity**:
   - No data loss risk (only adding new functionality)
   - Existing screen names remain unchanged
   - New screen names can be manually corrected if needed

## Appendix

### Database Schema

\```sql
-- user_profiles table (existing)
CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  screen_name TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  avatar_url TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  modified_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Indexes
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_user_profiles_screen_name ON user_profiles(screen_name);
CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_created_at ON user_profiles(created_at DESC);

-- RLS Policies
ALTER TABLE user_profiles ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
  ON user_profiles FOR SELECT
  USING (auth.uid() = id);

CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
  ON user_profiles FOR UPDATE
  USING (auth.uid() = id)
  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
\```

### API Reference

#### `GET /profile`
Returns current user's profile

**Response**:
\```json
{
  "id": "user-uuid",
  "screenName": "happy-panda-42",
  "avatarUrl": "https://...",
  "createdAt": "2025-01-01T00:00:00Z",
  "modifiedAt": "2025-01-02T00:00:00Z"
}
\```

#### `POST /profile/generate-screen-names`
Generates batch of screen name options

**Request**:
\```json
{
  "count": 10
}
\```

**Response**:
\```json
{
  "screenNames": [
    "happy-panda-42",
    "brave-falcon-17",
    "clever-otter-89",
    ...
  ]
}
\```

#### `PUT /profile/screen-name`
Updates user's screen name

**Request**:
\```json
{
  "screenName": "cool-cat-99"
}
\```

**Response**:
\```json
{
  "id": "user-uuid",
  "screenName": "cool-cat-99",
  "avatarUrl": "https://...",
  "createdAt": "2025-01-01T00:00:00Z",
  "modifiedAt": "2025-01-02T12:00:00Z"
}
\```

**Errors**:
- `400 Bad Request`: Screen name invalid or missing
- `409 Conflict`: Screen name already taken
- `401 Unauthorized`: User not authenticated

    67â†’
    68â†’### Design Principles
    69â†’
    70â†’1. **Interface-First**: All services implement clear interfaces
    71â†’2. **Dependency Injection**: Services injected via constructors
    72â†’3. **No Fallbacks**: Throw descriptive errors instead of using mock data
    73â†’4. **Type Safety**: Comprehensive TypeScript types throughout
    74â†’5. **Optimistic Updates**: UI updates immediately, rollback on error
    75â†’6. **Single Responsibility**: Each component has one clear purpose
    76â†’
    77â†’---
    78â†’
    79â†’## Database Changes
    80â†’
    81â†’### New Database Functions
    82â†’
    83â†’#### `generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER)`
    84â†’
    85â†’Generate multiple unique screen name options in a single call.
    86â†’
    87â†’\```sql
    88â†’-- Migration: 20251009_generate_screen_name_batch.sql
    89â†’
    90â†’CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER DEFAULT 10)
    91â†’RETURNS TABLE(screen_name TEXT) AS $$
    92â†’DECLARE
    93â†’  max_attempts INT := count * 5; -- Allow up to 5x attempts
    94â†’  attempts INT := 0;
    95â†’  generated_name TEXT;
    96â†’  names TEXT[] := '{}';
    97â†’BEGIN
    98â†’  -- Generate unique screen names
    99â†’  WHILE array_length(names, 1) < count AND attempts < max_attempts LOOP
   100â†’    attempts := attempts + 1;
   101â†’    generated_name := generate_friendly_screenname();
   102â†’
   103â†’    -- Check if name is unique (not in existing profiles and not in our batch)
   104â†’    IF NOT EXISTS (
   105â†’      SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE user_profiles.screen_name = generated_name
   106â†’    ) AND NOT (generated_name = ANY(names)) THEN
   107â†’      names := array_append(names, generated_name);
   108â†’    END IF;
   109â†’  END LOOP;
   110â†’
   111â†’  -- Return the generated names
   112â†’  RETURN QUERY SELECT unnest(names);
   113â†’END;
   114â†’$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
   115â†’
   116â†’COMMENT ON FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(INTEGER) IS
   117â†’  'Generates a batch of unique friendly screen names for user selection';
   118â†’\```
   119â†’
   120â†’#### `validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)`
   121â†’
   122â†’Validate that a screen name is available for use.
   123â†’
   124â†’\```sql
   125â†’-- Migration: 20251009_validate_screen_name_available.sql
   126â†’
   127â†’CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)
   128â†’RETURNS BOOLEAN AS $$
   129â†’BEGIN
   130â†’  RETURN NOT EXISTS (
   131â†’    SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE screen_name = name
   132â†’  );
   133â†’END;
   134â†’$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
   135â†’
   136â†’COMMENT ON FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(TEXT) IS
   137â†’  'Checks if a screen name is available (not already taken)';
   138â†’\```
   139â†’
   140â†’### RLS Policy Updates
   141â†’
   142â†’Add RLS policy to allow users to update their own profile:
   143â†’
   144â†’\```sql
   145â†’-- Migration: 20251009_profile_update_policy.sql
   146â†’
   147â†’-- Allow users to update their own profile
   148â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
   149â†’  ON user_profiles
   150â†’  FOR UPDATE
   151â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id)
   152â†’  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
   153â†’
   154â†’-- Allow users to read their own profile
   155â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
   156â†’  ON user_profiles
   157â†’  FOR SELECT
   158â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id);
   159â†’\```

   162â†’
   163â†’## Service Layer
   164â†’
   165â†’### UserProfileService Interface
   166â†’
   167â†’\```typescript
   168â†’// src/services/user-profile-service.ts
   169â†’
   170â†’/**
   171â†’ * User profile data
   172â†’ */
   173â†’export interface UserProfile {
   174â†’  id: string;
   175â†’  screenName: string;
   176â†’  avatarUrl?: string;
   177â†’  createdAt: string;
   178â†’  modifiedAt: string;
   179â†’}
   180â†’
   181â†’/**
   182â†’ * Database row type (snake_case)
   183â†’ */
   184â†’interface UserProfileRow {
   185â†’  id: string;
   186â†’  screen_name: string;
   187â†’  avatar_url: string | null;
   188â†’  created_at: string;
   189â†’  modified_at: string;
   190â†’}
   191â†’
   192â†’/**
   193â†’ * Interface for user profile operations
   194â†’ */
   195â†’export interface IUserProfileService {
   196â†’  /**
   197â†’   * Get the current user's profile
   198â†’   */
   199â†’  getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile>;
   200â†’
   201â†’  /**
   202â†’   * Generate multiple screen name options
   203â†’   *
   204â†’   * @param count Number of options to generate (default: 10)
   205â†’   * @returns Array of available screen names
   206â†’   */
   207â†’  generateScreenNameOptions(count?: number): Promise<string[]>;
   208â†’
   209â†’  /**
   210â†’   * Update the user's screen name
   211â†’   *
   212â†’   * @param newScreenName The new screen name to set
   213â†’   * @throws Error if screen name is already taken
   214â†’   */
   215â†’  updateScreenName(newScreenName: string): Promise<UserProfile>;
   216â†’
   217â†’  /**
   218â†’   * Validate that a screen name is available
   219â†’   *
   220â†’   * @param screenName Screen name to validate
   221â†’   * @returns true if available, false if taken
   222â†’   */
   223â†’  validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName: string): Promise<boolean>;
   224â†’}
   225â†’\```
   226â†’
   227â†’### UserProfileService Implementation
   228â†’
   229â†’\```typescript
   230â†’// src/services/user-profile-service.ts
   231â†’
   232â†’import { SupabaseClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';
   233â†’
   234â†’/**
   235â†’ * UserProfileService implementation using Supabase
   236â†’ */
   237â†’export class UserProfileService implements IUserProfileService {
   238â†’  private readonly supabase: SupabaseClient;
   239â†’
   240â†’  constructor(supabase: SupabaseClient) {
   241â†’    this.supabase = supabase;
   242â†’  }
   243â†’
   244â†’  /**
   245â†’   * Get current user ID from session
   246â†’   */
   247â†’  private async getCurrentUserId(): Promise<string> {
   248â†’    const { data: { user }, error } = await this.supabase.auth.getUser();
   249â†’
   250â†’    if (error || !user) {
   251â†’      throw new Error('User not authenticated. Please sign in to access profile.');
   252â†’    }
   253â†’
   254â†’    return user.id;
   255â†’  }
   256â†’
   257â†’  /**
   258â†’   * Convert database row to UserProfile
   259â†’   */
   260â†’  private toUserProfile(row: UserProfileRow): UserProfile {
   261â†’    return {
   262â†’      id: row.id,
   263â†’      screenName: row.screen_name,
   264â†’      avatarUrl: row.avatar_url || undefined,
   265â†’      createdAt: row.created_at,
   266â†’      modifiedAt: row.modified_at,
   267â†’    };
   268â†’  }
   269â†’
   270â†’  async getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile> {
   271â†’    const userId = await this.getCurrentUserId();
   272â†’
   273â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   274â†’      .from('user_profiles')
   275â†’      .select('*')
   276â†’      .eq('id', userId)
   277â†’      .single();
   278â†’
   279â†’    if (error) {
   280â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to fetch user profile: ${error.message}`);
   281â†’    }
   282â†’
   283â†’    if (!data) {
   284â†’      throw new Error('User profile not found. Profile should exist for authenticated users.');
   285â†’    }
   286â†’
   287â†’    return this.toUserProfile(data as UserProfileRow);
   288â†’  }
   289â†’
   290â†’  async generateScreenNameOptions(count: number = 10): Promise<string[]> {
   291â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   292â†’      .rpc('generate_screen_name_batch', { count });
   293â†’
   294â†’    if (error) {
   295â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to generate screen name options: ${error.message}`);
   296â†’    }
   297â†’
   298â†’    if (!data || data.length === 0) {
   299â†’      throw new Error('Failed to generate screen name options. Please try again.');
   300â†’    }
   301â†’
   302â†’    return data.map((row: { screen_name: string }) => row.screen_name);
   303â†’  }
   304â†’
   305â†’  async updateScreenName(newScreenName: string): Promise<UserProfile> {
   306â†’    const userId = await this.getCurrentUserId();
   307â†’
   308â†’    // Validate screen name is available
   309â†’    const isAvailable = await this.validateScreenNameAvailable(newScreenName);
   310â†’    if (!isAvailable) {
   311â†’      throw new Error(`Screen name "${newScreenName}" is already taken. Please choose another.`);
   312â†’    }
   313â†’
   314â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   315â†’      .from('user_profiles')
   316â†’      .update({ screen_name: newScreenName })
   317â†’      .eq('id', userId)
   318â†’      .select()
   319â†’      .single();
   320â†’
   321â†’    if (error) {
   322â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to update screen name: ${error.message}`);
   323â†’    }
   324â†’
   325â†’    if (!data) {
   326â†’      throw new Error('Failed to update screen name. No data returned from database.');
   327â†’    }
   328â†’
   329â†’    return this.toUserProfile(data as UserProfileRow);
   330â†’  }
   331â†’
   332â†’  async validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName: string): Promise<boolean> {
   333â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   334â†’      .rpc('validate_screen_name_available', { name: screenName });
   335â†’
   336â†’    if (error) {
   337â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to validate screen name: ${error.message}`);
   338â†’    }
   339â†’
   340â†’    return data === true;
   341â†’  }
   342â†’}
   343â†’
   344â†’/**
   345â†’ * Factory function to create UserProfileService
   346â†’ */
   347â†’export function createUserProfileService(supabase: SupabaseClient): IUserProfileService {
   348â†’  return new UserProfileService(supabase);
   349â†’}
   350â†’\```
   351â†’

   353â†’
   354â†’## API Design
   355â†’
   356â†’### React Query Hooks
   357â†’
   358â†’\```typescript
   359â†’// src/hooks/use-user-profile.ts
   360â†’
   361â†’import { useQuery, useMutation, useQueryClient } from '@tanstack/react-query';
   362â†’import { useSupabase } from '@/hooks/use-supabase';
   363â†’import { createUserProfileService, UserProfile } from '@/services/user-profile-service';
   364â†’import { toast } from '@/components/ui/sonner';
   365â†’
   366â†’/**
   367â†’ * Query keys for user profile queries
   368â†’ */
   369â†’export const userProfileKeys = {
   370â†’  all: ['userProfile'] as const,
   371â†’  profile: () => [...userProfileKeys.all, 'current'] as const,
   372â†’  screenNameOptions: () => [...userProfileKeys.all, 'screenNameOptions'] as const,
   373â†’};
   374â†’
   375â†’/**
   376â†’ * Hook to fetch current user profile
   377â†’ */
   378â†’export function useUserProfile() {
   379â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   380â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   381â†’
   382â†’  return useQuery({
   383â†’    queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile(),
   384â†’    queryFn: () => service.getUserProfile(),
   385â†’    staleTime: 5 * 60 * 1000, // 5 minutes
   386â†’  });
   387â†’}
   388â†’
   389â†’/**
   390â†’ * Hook to generate screen name options
   391â†’ */
   392â†’export function useGenerateScreenNames(count: number = 10) {
   393â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   394â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   395â†’
   396â†’  return useQuery({
   397â†’    queryKey: [...userProfileKeys.screenNameOptions(), count],
   398â†’    queryFn: () => service.generateScreenNameOptions(count),
   399â†’    staleTime: 0, // Always fetch fresh names
   400â†’    gcTime: 0, // Don't cache
   401â†’  });
   402â†’}
   403â†’
   404â†’/**
   405â†’ * Hook to update screen name with optimistic updates
   406â†’ */
   407â†’export function useUpdateScreenName() {
   408â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   409â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   410â†’  const queryClient = useQueryClient();
   411â†’
   412â†’  return useMutation({
   413â†’    mutationFn: (newScreenName: string) => service.updateScreenName(newScreenName),
   414â†’
   415â†’    // Optimistic update
   416â†’    onMutate: async (newScreenName: string) => {
   417â†’      // Cancel outgoing refetches
   418â†’      await queryClient.cancelQueries({ queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile() });
   419â†’
   420â†’      // Snapshot previous value
   421â†’      const previousProfile = queryClient.getQueryData<UserProfile>(
   422â†’        userProfileKeys.profile()
   423â†’      );
   424â†’
   425â†’      // Optimistically update
   426â†’      if (previousProfile) {
   427â†’        queryClient.setQueryData<UserProfile>(
   428â†’          userProfileKeys.profile(),
   429â†’          {
   430â†’            ...previousProfile,
   431â†’            screenName: newScreenName,
   432â†’          }
   433â†’        );
   434â†’      }
   435â†’
   436â†’      return { previousProfile };
   437â†’    },
   438â†’
   439â†’    // Rollback on error
   440â†’    onError: (error, newScreenName, context) => {
   441â†’      if (context?.previousProfile) {
   442â†’        queryClient.setQueryData(
   443â†’          userProfileKeys.profile(),
   444â†’          context.previousProfile
   445â†’        );
   446â†’      }
   447â†’
   448â†’      toast.error('Failed to Update Screen Name', {
   449â†’        description: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error occurred',
   450â†’      });
   451â†’    },
   452â†’
   453â†’    // Success
   454â†’    onSuccess: (updatedProfile) => {
   455â†’      queryClient.setQueryData(
   456â†’        userProfileKeys.profile(),
   457â†’        updatedProfile
   458â†’      );
   459â†’
   460â†’      toast.success('Screen Name Updated', {
   461â†’        description: `Your screen name is now "${updatedProfile.screenName}"`,
   462â†’      });
   463â†’    },
   464â†’
   465â†’    // Always refetch after error or success
   466â†’    onSettled: () => {
   467â†’      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile() });
   468â†’    },
   469â†’  });
   470â†’}
   471â†’
   472â†’/**
   473â†’ * Hook to validate screen name availability
   474â†’ */
   475â†’export function useValidateScreenName() {
   476â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   477â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   478â†’
   479â†’  return useMutation({
   480â†’    mutationFn: (screenName: string) => service.validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName),
   481â†’  });
   482â†’}
   483â†’\```
   484â†’

   491â†’**Responsibility**: Top-level page container

   527â†’### 2. ProfileHeader (`src/components/profile/ProfileHeader.tsx`)

   544â†’### 3. ScreenNameSection (`src/components/profile/ScreenNameSection.tsx`)
   545â†’

   555â†’**Features**:

   561â†’### 4. ScreenNamePicker (`src/components/profile/ScreenNamePicker.tsx`)
   562â†’
   563â†’**Responsibility**: Generate and display screen name options
   564â†’
   565â†’**Props**:
   566â†’\```typescript
   567â†’interface ScreenNamePickerProps {
   568â†’  currentScreenName: string;
   569â†’  onSelect: (screenName: string) => void;
   570â†’  selectedScreenName?: string;
   571â†’}
   572â†’\```
   573â†’
   574â†’**Features**:
   575â†’- Generate initial 10 options on mount
   576â†’- Radio group for selection
   577â†’- Regenerate button (fetches new batch)
   578â†’- Loading states during generation
   579â†’- Visual indication of current name if in list
   580â†’
   581â†’\```typescript
   582â†’export function ScreenNamePicker({
   583â†’  currentScreenName,
   584â†’  onSelect,
   585â†’  selectedScreenName,
   586â†’}: ScreenNamePickerProps): React.ReactElement {
   587â†’  const [optionCount] = React.useState(10);
   588â†’  const { data: options, isLoading, refetch, isFetching } = useGenerateScreenNames(optionCount);
   589â†’
   590â†’  const handleRegenerate = () => {
   591â†’    refetch();

   677â†’## User Flow & UX
   678â†’
   679â†’### Happy Path Flow
   680â†’
   681â†’\```
   682â†’1. User clicks "Profile" in navigation
   683â†’   â†“
   684â†’2. Profile page loads with current screen name
   685â†’   â†“
   686â†’3. User sees "Choose a Screen Name" section
   687â†’   â†“
   688â†’4. 10 screen name options are auto-generated and displayed
   689â†’   â†“
   690â†’5. User clicks radio button to select a new name
   691â†’   â†“
   692â†’6. "Save" button becomes enabled
   693â†’   â†“
   694â†’7. User clicks "Save"
   695â†’   â†“
   696â†’8. Optimistic update: UI shows new name immediately
   697â†’   â†“
   698â†’9. API request completes successfully
   699â†’   â†“
   700â†’10. Success toast: "Screen name updated!"
   701â†’   â†“
   702â†’11. Profile displays new screen name
   703â†’\```
   704â†’
   705â†’### Alternative Flows
   706â†’
   707â†’#### Regenerate Options
   708â†’\```
   709â†’1. User views initial 10 options
   710â†’   â†“
   711â†’2. User doesn't like any options
   712â†’   â†“
   713â†’3. User clicks "Regenerate Options"
   714â†’   â†“
   715â†’4. Button shows loading state
   716â†’   â†“
   717â†’5. New batch of 10 options appears
   718â†’   â†“
   719â†’6. Previous selection is cleared
   720â†’\```
   721â†’
   722â†’#### Screen Name Taken (Edge Case)
   723â†’\```
   724â†’1. User selects name "happy-panda-42"
   725â†’   â†“
   726â†’2. Another user takes that name before save
   727â†’   â†“
   728â†’3. User clicks "Save"
   729â†’   â†“
   730â†’4. API returns error: "Screen name already taken"
   731â†’   â†“
   732â†’5. Optimistic update rolls back
   733â†’   â†“
   734â†’6. Error toast displays
   735â†’   â†“
   736â†’7. User can select different name or regenerate
   737â†’\```
   738â†’
   739â†’#### Cancel Changes
   740â†’\```
   741â†’1. User selects new name
   742â†’   â†“
   743â†’2. User clicks "Cancel"
   744â†’   â†“
   745â†’3. Selection is cleared
   746â†’   â†“
   747â†’4. No API call made
   748â†’\```
   749â†’
   750â†’### UX Considerations
   751â†’
   752â†’1. **Immediate Feedback**: Optimistic updates make the UI feel instant
   753â†’2. **Clear Selection State**: Radio buttons with labels, current name badged
   754â†’3. **Loading States**: Skeletons and spinners during async operations
   755â†’4. **Error Recovery**: Clear error messages with actionable next steps
   756â†’5. **Accessibility**: Keyboard navigation, screen reader support, ARIA labels
   757â†’6. **Mobile Responsive**: Stack layout on small screens
   758â†’7. **Visual Hierarchy**: Clear sections with cards and separators
   759â†’
   760â†’---
   761â†’
   762â†’## Security Considerations
   763â†’
   764â†’### Row Level Security (RLS)
   765â†’
   766â†’All database operations must respect RLS policies:
   767â†’
   768â†’\```sql
   769â†’-- Users can only read their own profile
   770â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
   771â†’  ON user_profiles
   772â†’  FOR SELECT
   773â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id);
   774â†’
   775â†’-- Users can only update their own profile
   776â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
   777â†’  ON user_profiles
   778â†’  FOR UPDATE
   779â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id)
   780â†’  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
   781â†’\```
   782â†’
   783â†’### Validation Requirements
   784â†’
   785â†’1. **Server-Side Validation**:
   786â†’   - Screen name uniqueness check before update
   787â†’   - Screen name format validation (matches pattern)
   788â†’   - Rate limiting on screen name changes (optional future)
   789â†’
   790â†’2. **Client-Side Validation**:
   791â†’   - Non-empty selection
   792â†’   - Selection from generated options only
   793â†’   - Disable save if no changes
   794â†’
   795â†’3. **Authentication**:
   796â†’   - All API calls require authenticated user
   797â†’   - Service layer validates auth.uid() matches profile.id
   798â†’
   799â†’### Attack Vectors to Prevent
   800â†’
   801â†’1. **Race Conditions**: Two users selecting same name
   802â†’   - Mitigation: Database uniqueness constraint + validation before update
   803â†’
   804â†’2. **Enumeration**: Guessing valid screen names
   805â†’   - Mitigation: Only allow selection from generated options
   806â†’
   807â†’3. **Spam**: Rapid screen name changes
   808â†’   - Mitigation: (Future) Rate limit updates per user per day
   809â†’
   810â†’4. **SQL Injection**: Malicious input in screen name
   811â†’   - Mitigation: Parameterized queries (Supabase handles this)
   812â†’

  1413â†’## Risk Mitigation
  1414â†’
  1415â†’### Identified Risks
  1416â†’
  1417â†’| Risk | Impact | Probability | Mitigation |
  1418â†’|------|--------|-------------|------------|
  1419â†’| Race condition: two users select same name | High | Low | Database uniqueness constraint + validation before update |
  1420â†’| Screen name generation fails to produce unique names | Medium | Low | Batch generation with retry logic, fallback to UUID suffix |
  1421â†’| Optimistic update causes UI inconsistency | Medium | Low | Rollback on error, refetch after success |
  1422â†’| Performance degradation with large user base | Medium | Medium | Index on screen_name column, cache query results |
  1423â†’| User changes screen name too frequently | Low | Medium | (Future) Rate limit updates per user per day |
  1424â†’| Accessibility issues block users | High | Low | Comprehensive accessibility testing before launch |
  1425â†’
  1426â†’### Rollback Plan
  1427â†’
  1428â†’If critical issues occur in production:
  1429â†’
  1430â†’1. **Immediate Rollback**:
  1431â†’   - Revert application deployment to previous version
  1432â†’   - Keep database migrations in place (they don't break existing functionality)
  1433â†’   - Monitor error rates return to baseline
  1434â†’
  1435â†’2. **Partial Rollback**:
  1436â†’   - Hide "Profile" link from navigation via feature flag
  1437â†’   - Keep backend functionality intact
  1438â†’   - Investigate and fix issues in staging
  1439â†’
  1440â†’3. **Data Integrity**:
  1441â†’   - No data loss risk (only adding new functionality)
  1442â†’   - Existing screen names remain unchanged
  1443â†’   - New screen names can be manually corrected if needed
  1444â†’

  1464â†’## Appendix
  1465â†’
  1466â†’### Database Schema
  1467â†’
  1468â†’\```sql
  1469â†’-- user_profiles table (existing)
  1470â†’CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
  1471â†’  id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  1472â†’  screen_name TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  1473â†’  avatar_url TEXT,
  1474â†’  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  1475â†’  modified_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
  1476â†’);
  1477â†’
  1478â†’-- Indexes
  1479â†’CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_user_profiles_screen_name ON user_profiles(screen_name);
  1480â†’CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_created_at ON user_profiles(created_at DESC);
  1481â†’
  1482â†’-- RLS Policies
  1483â†’ALTER TABLE user_profiles ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
  1484â†’
  1485â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
  1486â†’  ON user_profiles FOR SELECT
  1487â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id);
  1488â†’
  1489â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
  1490â†’  ON user_profiles FOR UPDATE
  1491â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id)
  1492â†’  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
  1493â†’\```

    68â†’### Design Principles
    69â†’
    70â†’1. **Interface-First**: All services implement clear interfaces
    71â†’2. **Dependency Injection**: Services injected via constructors
    72â†’3. **No Fallbacks**: Throw descriptive errors instead of using mock data
    73â†’4. **Type Safety**: Comprehensive TypeScript types throughout
    74â†’5. **Optimistic Updates**: UI updates immediately, rollback on error
    75â†’6. **Single Responsibility**: Each component has one clear purpose
    76â†’
    77â†’---
    78â†’
    79â†’## Database Changes
    80â†’
    81â†’### New Database Functions
    82â†’
    83â†’#### `generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER)`
    84â†’
    85â†’Generate multiple unique screen name options in a single call.
    86â†’
    87â†’\```sql
    88â†’-- Migration: 20251009_generate_screen_name_batch.sql
    89â†’
    90â†’CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER DEFAULT 10)
    91â†’RETURNS TABLE(screen_name TEXT) AS $$
    92â†’DECLARE
    93â†’  max_attempts INT := count * 5; -- Allow up to 5x attempts
    94â†’  attempts INT := 0;
    95â†’  generated_name TEXT;
    96â†’  names TEXT[] := '{}';
    97â†’BEGIN
    98â†’  -- Generate unique screen names
    99â†’  WHILE array_length(names, 1) < count AND attempts < max_attempts LOOP
   100â†’    attempts := attempts + 1;
   101â†’    generated_name := generate_friendly_screenname();
   102â†’
   103â†’    -- Check if name is unique (not in existing profiles and not in our batch)
   104â†’    IF NOT EXISTS (
   105â†’      SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE user_profiles.screen_name = generated_name
   106â†’    ) AND NOT (generated_name = ANY(names)) THEN
   107â†’      names := array_append(names, generated_name);
   108â†’    END IF;
   109â†’  END LOOP;
   110â†’
   111â†’  -- Return the generated names
   112â†’  RETURN QUERY SELECT unnest(names);
   113â†’END;
   114â†’$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
   115â†’
   116â†’COMMENT ON FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(INTEGER) IS
   117â†’  'Generates a batch of unique friendly screen names for user selection';
   118â†’\```
   119â†’
   120â†’#### `validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)`
   121â†’
   122â†’Validate that a screen name is available for use.
   123â†’
   124â†’\```sql
   125â†’-- Migration: 20251009_validate_screen_name_available.sql
   126â†’
   127â†’CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)
   128â†’RETURNS BOOLEAN AS $$
   129â†’BEGIN
   130â†’  RETURN NOT EXISTS (
   131â†’    SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE screen_name = name
   132â†’  );
   133â†’END;
   134â†’$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
   135â†’
   136â†’COMMENT ON FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(TEXT) IS
   137â†’  'Checks if a screen name is available (not already taken)';
   138â†’\```
   139â†’
   140â†’### RLS Policy Updates
   141â†’
   142â†’Add RLS policy to allow users to update their own profile:
   143â†’
   144â†’\```sql
   145â†’-- Migration: 20251009_profile_update_policy.sql
   146â†’
   147â†’-- Allow users to update their own profile
   148â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
   149â†’  ON user_profiles
   150â†’  FOR UPDATE
   151â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id)
   152â†’  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
   153â†’
   154â†’-- Allow users to read their own profile
   155â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
   156â†’  ON user_profiles
   157â†’  FOR SELECT
   158â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id);
   159â†’\```

   162â†’
   163â†’## Service Layer
   164â†’
   165â†’### UserProfileService Interface
   166â†’
   167â†’\```typescript
   168â†’// src/services/user-profile-service.ts
   169â†’
   170â†’/**
   171â†’ * User profile data
   172â†’ */
   173â†’export interface UserProfile {
   174â†’  id: string;
   175â†’  screenName: string;
   176â†’  avatarUrl?: string;
   177â†’  createdAt: string;
   178â†’  modifiedAt: string;
   179â†’}
   180â†’
   181â†’/**
   182â†’ * Database row type (snake_case)
   183â†’ */
   184â†’interface UserProfileRow {
   185â†’  id: string;
   186â†’  screen_name: string;
   187â†’  avatar_url: string | null;
   188â†’  created_at: string;
   189â†’  modified_at: string;
   190â†’}
   191â†’
   192â†’/**
   193â†’ * Interface for user profile operations
   194â†’ */
   195â†’export interface IUserProfileService {
   196â†’  /**
   197â†’   * Get the current user's profile
   198â†’   */
   199â†’  getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile>;
   200â†’
   201â†’  /**
   202â†’   * Generate multiple screen name options
   203â†’   *
   204â†’   * @param count Number of options to generate (default: 10)
   205â†’   * @returns Array of available screen names
   206â†’   */
   207â†’  generateScreenNameOptions(count?: number): Promise<string[]>;
   208â†’
   209â†’  /**
   210â†’   * Update the user's screen name
   211â†’   *
   212â†’   * @param newScreenName The new screen name to set
   213â†’   * @throws Error if screen name is already taken
   214â†’   */
   215â†’  updateScreenName(newScreenName: string): Promise<UserProfile>;
   216â†’
   217â†’  /**
   218â†’   * Validate that a screen name is available
   219â†’   *
   220â†’   * @param screenName Screen name to validate
   221â†’   * @returns true if available, false if taken
   222â†’   */
   223â†’  validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName: string): Promise<boolean>;
   224â†’}
   225â†’\```
   226â†’
   227â†’### UserProfileService Implementation
   228â†’
   229â†’\```typescript
   230â†’// src/services/user-profile-service.ts
   231â†’
   232â†’import { SupabaseClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';
   233â†’
   234â†’/**
   235â†’ * UserProfileService implementation using Supabase
   236â†’ */
   237â†’export class UserProfileService implements IUserProfileService {
   238â†’  private readonly supabase: SupabaseClient;
   239â†’
   240â†’  constructor(supabase: SupabaseClient) {
   241â†’    this.supabase = supabase;
   242â†’  }
   243â†’
   244â†’  /**
   245â†’   * Get current user ID from session
   246â†’   */
   247â†’  private async getCurrentUserId(): Promise<string> {
   248â†’    const { data: { user }, error } = await this.supabase.auth.getUser();
   249â†’
   250â†’    if (error || !user) {
   251â†’      throw new Error('User not authenticated. Please sign in to access profile.');
   252â†’    }
   253â†’
   254â†’    return user.id;
   255â†’  }
   256â†’
   257â†’  /**
   258â†’   * Convert database row to UserProfile
   259â†’   */
   260â†’  private toUserProfile(row: UserProfileRow): UserProfile {
   261â†’    return {
   262â†’      id: row.id,
   263â†’      screenName: row.screen_name,
   264â†’      avatarUrl: row.avatar_url || undefined,
   265â†’      createdAt: row.created_at,
   266â†’      modifiedAt: row.modified_at,
   267â†’    };
   268â†’  }
   269â†’
   270â†’  async getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile> {
   271â†’    const userId = await this.getCurrentUserId();
   272â†’
   273â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   274â†’      .from('user_profiles')
   275â†’      .select('*')
   276â†’      .eq('id', userId)
   277â†’      .single();
   278â†’
   279â†’    if (error) {
   280â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to fetch user profile: ${error.message}`);
   281â†’    }
   282â†’
   283â†’    if (!data) {
   284â†’      throw new Error('User profile not found. Profile should exist for authenticated users.');
   285â†’    }
   286â†’
   287â†’    return this.toUserProfile(data as UserProfileRow);
   288â†’  }
   289â†’
   290â†’  async generateScreenNameOptions(count: number = 10): Promise<string[]> {
   291â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   292â†’      .rpc('generate_screen_name_batch', { count });
   293â†’
   294â†’    if (error) {
   295â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to generate screen name options: ${error.message}`);
   296â†’    }
   297â†’
   298â†’    if (!data || data.length === 0) {
   299â†’      throw new Error('Failed to generate screen name options. Please try again.');
   300â†’    }
   301â†’
   302â†’    return data.map((row: { screen_name: string }) => row.screen_name);
   303â†’  }
   304â†’
   305â†’  async updateScreenName(newScreenName: string): Promise<UserProfile> {
   306â†’    const userId = await this.getCurrentUserId();
   307â†’
   308â†’    // Validate screen name is available
   309â†’    const isAvailable = await this.validateScreenNameAvailable(newScreenName);
   310â†’    if (!isAvailable) {
   311â†’      throw new Error(`Screen name "${newScreenName}" is already taken. Please choose another.`);
   312â†’    }
   313â†’
   314â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   315â†’      .from('user_profiles')
   316â†’      .update({ screen_name: newScreenName })
   317â†’      .eq('id', userId)
   318â†’      .select()
   319â†’      .single();
   320â†’
   321â†’    if (error) {
   322â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to update screen name: ${error.message}`);
   323â†’    }
   324â†’
   325â†’    if (!data) {
   326â†’      throw new Error('Failed to update screen name. No data returned from database.');
   327â†’    }
   328â†’
   329â†’    return this.toUserProfile(data as UserProfileRow);
   330â†’  }
   331â†’
   332â†’  async validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName: string): Promise<boolean> {
   333â†’    const { data, error } = await this.supabase
   334â†’      .rpc('validate_screen_name_available', { name: screenName });
   335â†’
   336â†’    if (error) {
   337â†’      throw new Error(`Failed to validate screen name: ${error.message}`);
   338â†’    }
   339â†’
   340â†’    return data === true;
   341â†’  }
   342â†’}
   343â†’
   344â†’/**
   345â†’ * Factory function to create UserProfileService
   346â†’ */
   347â†’export function createUserProfileService(supabase: SupabaseClient): IUserProfileService {
   348â†’  return new UserProfileService(supabase);
   349â†’}
   350â†’\```
   351â†’

   353â†’
   354â†’## API Design
   355â†’
   356â†’### React Query Hooks
   357â†’
   358â†’\```typescript
   359â†’// src/hooks/use-user-profile.ts
   360â†’
   361â†’import { useQuery, useMutation, useQueryClient } from '@tanstack/react-query';
   362â†’import { useSupabase } from '@/hooks/use-supabase';
   363â†’import { createUserProfileService, UserProfile } from '@/services/user-profile-service';
   364â†’import { toast } from '@/components/ui/sonner';
   365â†’
   366â†’/**
   367â†’ * Query keys for user profile queries
   368â†’ */
   369â†’export const userProfileKeys = {
   370â†’  all: ['userProfile'] as const,
   371â†’  profile: () => [...userProfileKeys.all, 'current'] as const,
   372â†’  screenNameOptions: () => [...userProfileKeys.all, 'screenNameOptions'] as const,
   373â†’};
   374â†’
   375â†’/**
   376â†’ * Hook to fetch current user profile
   377â†’ */
   378â†’export function useUserProfile() {
   379â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   380â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   381â†’
   382â†’  return useQuery({
   383â†’    queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile(),
   384â†’    queryFn: () => service.getUserProfile(),
   385â†’    staleTime: 5 * 60 * 1000, // 5 minutes
   386â†’  });
   387â†’}
   388â†’
   389â†’/**
   390â†’ * Hook to generate screen name options
   391â†’ */
   392â†’export function useGenerateScreenNames(count: number = 10) {
   393â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   394â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   395â†’
   396â†’  return useQuery({
   397â†’    queryKey: [...userProfileKeys.screenNameOptions(), count],
   398â†’    queryFn: () => service.generateScreenNameOptions(count),
   399â†’    staleTime: 0, // Always fetch fresh names
   400â†’    gcTime: 0, // Don't cache
   401â†’  });
   402â†’}
   403â†’
   404â†’/**
   405â†’ * Hook to update screen name with optimistic updates
   406â†’ */
   407â†’export function useUpdateScreenName() {
   408â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   409â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   410â†’  const queryClient = useQueryClient();
   411â†’
   412â†’  return useMutation({
   413â†’    mutationFn: (newScreenName: string) => service.updateScreenName(newScreenName),
   414â†’
   415â†’    // Optimistic update
   416â†’    onMutate: async (newScreenName: string) => {
   417â†’      // Cancel outgoing refetches
   418â†’      await queryClient.cancelQueries({ queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile() });
   419â†’
   420â†’      // Snapshot previous value
   421â†’      const previousProfile = queryClient.getQueryData<UserProfile>(
   422â†’        userProfileKeys.profile()
   423â†’      );
   424â†’
   425â†’      // Optimistically update
   426â†’      if (previousProfile) {
   427â†’        queryClient.setQueryData<UserProfile>(
   428â†’          userProfileKeys.profile(),
   429â†’          {
   430â†’            ...previousProfile,
   431â†’            screenName: newScreenName,
   432â†’          }
   433â†’        );
   434â†’      }
   435â†’
   436â†’      return { previousProfile };
   437â†’    },
   438â†’
   439â†’    // Rollback on error
   440â†’    onError: (error, newScreenName, context) => {
   441â†’      if (context?.previousProfile) {
   442â†’        queryClient.setQueryData(
   443â†’          userProfileKeys.profile(),
   444â†’          context.previousProfile
   445â†’        );
   446â†’      }
   447â†’
   448â†’      toast.error('Failed to Update Screen Name', {
   449â†’        description: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error occurred',
   450â†’      });
   451â†’    },
   452â†’
   453â†’    // Success
   454â†’    onSuccess: (updatedProfile) => {
   455â†’      queryClient.setQueryData(
   456â†’        userProfileKeys.profile(),
   457â†’        updatedProfile
   458â†’      );
   459â†’
   460â†’      toast.success('Screen Name Updated', {
   461â†’        description: `Your screen name is now "${updatedProfile.screenName}"`,
   462â†’      });
   463â†’    },
   464â†’
   465â†’    // Always refetch after error or success
   466â†’    onSettled: () => {
   467â†’      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: userProfileKeys.profile() });
   468â†’    },
   469â†’  });
   470â†’}
   471â†’
   472â†’/**
   473â†’ * Hook to validate screen name availability
   474â†’ */
   475â†’export function useValidateScreenName() {
   476â†’  const supabase = useSupabase();
   477â†’  const service = createUserProfileService(supabase);
   478â†’
   479â†’  return useMutation({
   480â†’    mutationFn: (screenName: string) => service.validateScreenNameAvailable(screenName),
   481â†’  });
   482â†’}
   483â†’\```

   487â†’## Component Breakdown

   676â†’
   677â†’## User Flow & UX
   678â†’
   679â†’### Happy Path Flow
   680â†’
   681â†’\```
   682â†’1. User clicks "Profile" in navigation
   683â†’   â†“
   684â†’2. Profile page loads with current screen name
   685â†’   â†“
   686â†’3. User sees "Choose a Screen Name" section
   687â†’   â†“
   688â†’4. 10 screen name options are auto-generated and displayed
   689â†’   â†“
   690â†’5. User clicks radio button to select a new name
   691â†’   â†“
   692â†’6. "Save" button becomes enabled
   693â†’   â†“
   694â†’7. User clicks "Save"
   695â†’   â†“
   696â†’8. Optimistic update: UI shows new name immediately
   697â†’   â†“
   698â†’9. API request completes successfully
   699â†’   â†“
   700â†’10. Success toast: "Screen name updated!"
   701â†’   â†“
   702â†’11. Profile displays new screen name
   703â†’\```
   704â†’
   705â†’### Alternative Flows
   706â†’
   707â†’#### Regenerate Options
   708â†’\```
   709â†’1. User views initial 10 options
   710â†’   â†“
   711â†’2. User doesn't like any options
   712â†’   â†“
   713â†’3. User clicks "Regenerate Options"
   714â†’   â†“
   715â†’4. Button shows loading state
   716â†’   â†“
   717â†’5. New batch of 10 options appears
   718â†’   â†“
   719â†’6. Previous selection is cleared
   720â†’\```
   721â†’
   722â†’#### Screen Name Taken (Edge Case)
   723â†’\```
   724â†’1. User selects name "happy-panda-42"
   725â†’   â†“
   726â†’2. Another user takes that name before save
   727â†’   â†“
   728â†’3. User clicks "Save"
   729â†’   â†“
   730â†’4. API returns error: "Screen name already taken"
   731â†’   â†“
   732â†’5. Optimistic update rolls back
   733â†’   â†“
   734â†’6. Error toast displays
   735â†’   â†“
   736â†’7. User can select different name or regenerate
   737â†’\```
   738â†’
   739â†’#### Cancel Changes
   740â†’\```
   741â†’1. User selects new name
   742â†’   â†“
   743â†’2. User clicks "Cancel"
   744â†’   â†“
   745â†’3. Selection is cleared
   746â†’   â†“
   747â†’4. No API call made
   748â†’\```
   749â†’
   750â†’### UX Considerations
   751â†’
   752â†’1. **Immediate Feedback**: Optimistic updates make the UI feel instant
   753â†’2. **Clear Selection State**: Radio buttons with labels, current name badged
   754â†’3. **Loading States**: Skeletons and spinners during async operations
   755â†’4. **Error Recovery**: Clear error messages with actionable next steps
   756â†’5. **Accessibility**: Keyboard navigation, screen reader support, ARIA labels
   757â†’6. **Mobile Responsive**: Stack layout on small screens
   758â†’7. **Visual Hierarchy**: Clear sections with cards and separators
   759â†’
   760â†’---
   761â†’
   762â†’## Security Considerations
   763â†’
   764â†’### Row Level Security (RLS)
   765â†’
   766â†’All database operations must respect RLS policies:
   767â†’
   768â†’\```sql
   769â†’-- Users can only read their own profile
   770â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
   771â†’  ON user_profiles
   772â†’  FOR SELECT
   773â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id);
   774â†’
   775â†’-- Users can only update their own profile
   776â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
   777â†’  ON user_profiles
   778â†’  FOR UPDATE
   779â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id)
   780â†’  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
   781â†’\```
   782â†’
   783â†’### Validation Requirements
   784â†’
   785â†’1. **Server-Side Validation**:
   786â†’   - Screen name uniqueness check before update
   787â†’   - Screen name format validation (matches pattern)
   788â†’   - Rate limiting on screen name changes (optional future)
   789â†’
   790â†’2. **Client-Side Validation**:
   791â†’   - Non-empty selection
   792â†’   - Selection from generated options only
   793â†’   - Disable save if no changes
   794â†’
   795â†’3. **Authentication**:
   796â†’   - All API calls require authenticated user
   797â†’   - Service layer validates auth.uid() matches profile.id
   798â†’
   799â†’### Attack Vectors to Prevent
   800â†’
   801â†’1. **Race Conditions**: Two users selecting same name
   802â†’   - Mitigation: Database uniqueness constraint + validation before update
   803â†’
   804â†’2. **Enumeration**: Guessing valid screen names
   805â†’   - Mitigation: Only allow selection from generated options
   806â†’
   807â†’3. **Spam**: Rapid screen name changes
   808â†’   - Mitigation: (Future) Rate limit updates per user per day
   809â†’
   810â†’4. **SQL Injection**: Malicious input in screen name
   811â†’   - Mitigation: Parameterized queries (Supabase handles this)
   812â†’

  1413â†’## Risk Mitigation
  1414â†’
  1415â†’### Identified Risks
  1416â†’
  1417â†’| Risk | Impact | Probability | Mitigation |
  1418â†’|------|--------|-------------|------------|
  1419â†’| Race condition: two users select same name | High | Low | Database uniqueness constraint + validation before update |
  1420â†’| Screen name generation fails to produce unique names | Medium | Low | Batch generation with retry logic, fallback to UUID suffix |
  1421â†’| Optimistic update causes UI inconsistency | Medium | Low | Rollback on error, refetch after success |
  1422â†’| Performance degradation with large user base | Medium | Medium | Index on screen_name column, cache query results |
  1423â†’| User changes screen name too frequently | Low | Medium | (Future) Rate limit updates per user per day |
  1424â†’| Accessibility issues block users | High | Low | Comprehensive accessibility testing before launch |
  1425â†’
  1426â†’### Rollback Plan
  1427â†’
  1428â†’If critical issues occur in production:
  1429â†’
  1430â†’1. **Immediate Rollback**:
  1431â†’   - Revert application deployment to previous version
  1432â†’   - Keep database migrations in place (they don't break existing functionality)
  1433â†’   - Monitor error rates return to baseline
  1434â†’
  1435â†’2. **Partial Rollback**:
  1436â†’   - Hide "Profile" link from navigation via feature flag
  1437â†’   - Keep backend functionality intact
  1438â†’   - Investigate and fix issues in staging
  1439â†’
  1440â†’3. **Data Integrity**:
  1441â†’   - No data loss risk (only adding new functionality)
  1442â†’   - Existing screen names remain unchanged
  1443â†’   - New screen names can be manually corrected if needed
  1444â†’

  1464â†’## Appendix
  1465â†’
  1466â†’### Database Schema
  1467â†’
  1468â†’\```sql
  1469â†’-- user_profiles table (existing)
  1470â†’CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
  1471â†’  id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  1472â†’  screen_name TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  1473â†’  avatar_url TEXT,
  1474â†’  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  1475â†’  modified_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
  1476â†’);
  1477â†’
  1478â†’-- Indexes
  1479â†’CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_user_profiles_screen_name ON user_profiles(screen_name);
  1480â†’CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_created_at ON user_profiles(created_at DESC);
  1481â†’
  1482â†’-- RLS Policies
  1483â†’ALTER TABLE user_profiles ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
  1484â†’
  1485â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can read own profile"
  1486â†’  ON user_profiles FOR SELECT
  1487â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id);
  1488â†’
  1489â†’CREATE POLICY "Users can update own profile"
  1490â†’  ON user_profiles FOR UPDATE
  1491â†’  USING (auth.uid() = id)
  1492â†’  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
  1493â†’\```
  1494â†’
  1495â†’### API Reference
  1496â†’
  1497â†’#### `GET /profile`
  1498â†’Returns current user's profile
  1499â†’
  1500â†’**Response**:
  1501â†’\```json
  1502â†’{
  1503â†’  "id": "user-uuid",
  1504â†’  "screenName": "happy-panda-42",
  1505â†’  "avatarUrl": "https://...",
  1506â†’  "createdAt": "2025-01-01T00:00:00Z",
  1507â†’  "modifiedAt": "2025-01-02T00:00:00Z"
  1508â†’}
  1509â†’\```
  1510â†’
  1511â†’#### `POST /profile/generate-screen-names`
  1512â†’Generates batch of screen name options
  1513â†’
  1514â†’**Request**:
  1515â†’\```json
  1516â†’{
  1517â†’  "count": 10
  1518â†’}
  1519â†’\```
  1520â†’
  1521â†’**Response**:
  1522â†’\```json
  1523â†’{
  1524â†’  "screenNames": [
  1525â†’    "happy-panda-42",
  1526â†’    "brave-falcon-17",
  1527â†’    "clever-otter-89",
  1528â†’    ...
  1529â†’  ]
  1530â†’}
  1531â†’\```

  adjectives TEXT[] := ARRAY[
    'happy', 'clever', 'bright', 'swift', 'brave', 'calm', 'cool', 'eager',
    'fair', 'gentle', 'jolly', 'kind', 'lively', 'merry', 'nice', 'proud',

  nouns TEXT[] := ARRAY[
    'panda', 'falcon', 'tiger', 'eagle', 'bear', 'wolf', 'fox', 'hawk',
    'lion', 'otter', 'raven', 'swan', 'whale', 'lynx', 'cobra', 'crane',
    'moose', 'bison', 'gecko', 'koala', 'lemur', 'meerkat', 'Phoenix', 'dragon',

```sql
-- Migration: 20251009160000_generate_screen_name_batch.sql
-- Description: Create function to generate batches of unique screen names
-- Created: 2025-10-09

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER DEFAULT 10)
RETURNS TABLE(screen_name TEXT) AS $$
DECLARE
  max_attempts INT := count * 5; -- Allow up to 5x attempts
  attempts INT := 0;
  generated_name TEXT;
  names TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
  -- Generate unique screen names
  WHILE array_length(names, 1) IS NULL OR array_length(names, 1) < count AND attempts < max_attempts LOOP
    attempts := attempts + 1;
    generated_name := generate_friendly_screenname();

    -- Check if name is unique (not in existing profiles and not in our batch)
    IF NOT EXISTS (
      SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE user_profiles.screen_name = generated_name
    ) AND NOT (generated_name = ANY(names)) THEN
      names := array_append(names, generated_name);
    END IF;
  END LOOP;

  -- Return the generated names
  RETURN QUERY SELECT unnest(names);
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

COMMENT ON FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(INTEGER) IS
  'Generates a batch of unique friendly screen names for user selection';

```

```sql
-- ============================================================================
-- PROFILE SCREEN NAME BATCH GENERATION AND VALIDATION
-- Adds batch generation and validation functions for user profile screen names
-- ============================================================================

-- Function to generate a batch of unique screen names
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(count INTEGER DEFAULT 10)
RETURNS TABLE(screen_name TEXT) AS $$
DECLARE
  max_attempts INT := count * 5; -- Allow up to 5x attempts
  attempts INT := 0;
  generated_name TEXT;
  names TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
  -- Generate unique screen names
  WHILE array_length(names, 1) < count AND attempts < max_attempts LOOP
    attempts := attempts + 1;
    generated_name := generate_friendly_screenname();

    -- Check if name is unique (not in existing profiles and not in our batch)
    IF NOT EXISTS (
      SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE user_profiles.screen_name = generated_name
    ) AND NOT (generated_name = ANY(names)) THEN
      names := array_append(names, generated_name);
    END IF;
  END LOOP;

  -- Return the generated names
  RETURN QUERY SELECT unnest(names);
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

COMMENT ON FUNCTION generate_screen_name_batch(INTEGER) IS
  'Generates a batch of unique friendly screen names for user selection';

-- Function to validate that a screen name is available
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(name TEXT)
RETURNS BOOLEAN AS $$
BEGIN
  RETURN NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1 FROM user_profiles WHERE screen_name = name
  );
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

COMMENT ON FUNCTION validate_screen_name_available(TEXT) IS
  'Checks if a screen name is available (not already taken)';

-- Add RLS policies for profile updates
CREATE POLICY IF NOT EXISTS "Users can read own profile"
  ON user_profiles
  FOR SELECT
  USING (auth.uid() = id);

CREATE POLICY IF NOT EXISTS "Users can update own profile"
  ON user_profiles
  FOR UPDATE
  USING (auth.uid() = id)
  WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
```
